div.p: From William Benson to William Odgers
Z71/11870, unit 576, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
To proof.
Botanic Garden Inquiry Board

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I am instructed by the above Board to inquire whether (in accordance with a request from Dr von Mueller) there is any objection
underlined in ink and with X in pencil in an unknown hand.
to his being furnished with a copy of the minute of the Executive Council as to placing a practical Gardener in charge of the Botanic Gardens.
On 4 October CGD minuted: 'Let Dr Mueller have a copy of the minute — Request the Board to report as speedily as practicable'.

I have also to inform you that the long illness of Wm Hamill Esqre the Chairman has most unhappily terminated fatally, and that at a meeting of the Board held the 13th inst W. J. Greig Esqr was elected Chairman .
was elected Chairman underlined in pencil and the latter part of the paragraph has a pencilled exclamation mark against it by an unknown hand.
The Board meets again tomorrow, Saturday 16th.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be Sir

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

William Benson
William Benson has not been further identified.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
W. H. Odgers Esqur
MS annotation at the bottom of the page marked with X: 'i.e. the terms of the Board's appointment —' Odgers minuted: 'I see no objection but I think the Bd shd have asked the C. S. [Chief Secretary] it was desired to appoint another Chairman — the L. Assembly has recently expressed an opinion that Mr. Ferguson shd be removed from the Gardens'.
